name: Cyprus
description: Cyprus, the 'Island of Love', is a Mediterranean island nation with a rich history, diverse landscapes, and unique biodiversity. Situated just off the coast of mainland Turkey, it boasts a varied terrain ranging from rugged mountains and volcanic landscapes to fertile plains and stunning coastlines. The island’s strategic location has shaped its cultural heritage, blending influences from Greece, Rome, Byzantium, the Ottoman Empire, and Britain.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The capital city, divided since 1974, is a fascinating blend of cultures and architectural styles.
quickFacts.detail: Nicosia is the largest city in Cyprus and the administrative center of the Republic of Cyprus.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Cyprus has a vibrant and welcoming population.
quickFacts.detail: The population is comprised of Greek Cypriots and Turkish Cypriots, alongside smaller communities.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Two official languages reflect the island's complex history.
quickFacts.detail: Greek is the most widely spoken language, while Turkish is still prevalent in Northern Cyprus.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The Euro is the official currency of Cyprus.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: A relatively small island with a huge amount to offer.
quickFacts.detail: Cyprus is the third-largest island in the Mediterranean.

quickFacts.label: Average Temperature
quickFacts.description: Mild winters and hot, dry summers.

climateData.title: Mediterranean Climate
climateData.description: Cyprus enjoys a classic Mediterranean climate characterized by hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters. The island benefits from abundant sunshine throughout the year, making it a popular destination for sun-seekers.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Long, hot, and dry days with intense sunshine. Temperatures frequently exceed 35°C (95°F).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Pleasant temperatures and decreasing rainfall. The landscape transforms with vibrant autumn colors.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Mild winters with occasional rainfall. Temperatures rarely drop below 10°C (50°F).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Warm temperatures and blossoming flowers. A beautiful time to visit the island.

naturalWonders.name: Troodos Mountains
naturalWonders.description: The Troodos Mountains, a volcanic range in central Cyprus, offer stunning scenery, ancient monasteries, and cooler temperatures. They are a haven for hikers and nature lovers.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Formed by volcanic activity millions of years ago, the Troodos Mountains are the highest point on the island. The range is home to diverse flora and fauna, including endemic species. Several historic monasteries, built into the mountainsides, add to the area's cultural significance.
naturalWonders.bestTime: Year-round, but particularly beautiful in spring and autumn.
viewingTips: Check the weather forecast before heading out.

naturalWonders.name: Zenobia Shipwreck
naturalWonders.description: The Zenobia, a massive cargo ship, tragically sank off the coast of Larnaca in 1980, creating a unique underwater dive site.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Zenobia was en route to Italy when it encountered a severe storm and ran aground on a sandbank. The ship remains remarkably intact, offering a fascinating glimpse into maritime history. Divers can explore the ship's cargo holds and admire the marine life that has taken up residence within its hull.

naturalWonders.name: Cape Greco National Forest Park
naturalWonders.description: A stunning coastal park boasting dramatic cliffs, hidden coves, and crystal-clear waters. It's a popular destination for hiking, swimming, and exploring.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Located on the southeastern coast of Cyprus, Cape Greco National Forest Park is renowned for its unique geological formations, including sea caves and arches. The park offers a diverse range of activities, from hiking along coastal trails to snorkeling and diving in the turquoise waters. The area is also home to a variety of bird species.

biodiversityCategory.name: Mediterranean Flora
biodiversityCategory.description: Cyprus boasts a unique Mediterranean flora adapted to the island’s hot, dry climate. Many species are endemic, meaning they are found nowhere else in the world.

statistics.details: Approximately 10% of Cyprus’s plant species are endemic.
Cyprus is renowned for its olive groves, which cover a significant portion of the landscape.

notableSpecies.name: Cretan Dietes
notableSpecies.significance: A rare lily species found only in Cyprus.

notableSpecies.name: Cyprus Olive
notableSpecies.significance: The source of Cyprus’s famous olive oil.

ecosystemData.title: Coastal Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Cyprus’s coastline is a mosaic of diverse ecosystems, including sandy beaches, rocky cliffs, and seagrass meadows. These ecosystems provide vital habitats for a wide range of marine and terrestrial species.

biodiversityCategories.name: Marine Biodiversity
biodiversityCategories.description: The waters surrounding Cyprus are home to a rich diversity of marine life, including fish, seabirds, and marine mammals.

statistics.details: Cyprus is an important breeding ground for numerous seabird species.

notableSpecies.name: Loggerhead Turtle
notableSpecies.significance: A nesting site for endangered loggerhead turtles.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Cyprus
activities.description: Cyprus offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all interests and abilities, from hiking and cycling to water sports and wildlife watching.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the island’s diverse landscapes on foot.

activities.name: Troodos Mountains Hike
activities.description: Hike through the scenic Troodos Mountains, visiting monasteries and enjoying panoramic views.

activities.name: Akamas Peninsula Trail
activities.description: A challenging hike through the rugged Akamas Peninsula, offering stunning coastal views.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water sports in Cyprus’s crystal-clear waters.

activities.name: Scuba Diving
activities.description: Explore the underwater world of Cyprus, including shipwrecks and coral reefs.
activities.requirements: Scuba certification, wetsuit (depending on water temperature).

activities.name: Sailing
activities.description: Charter a sailboat and explore the coastline at your own pace.

clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket, scarf, gloves.

safety: Be aware of the sun's intensity
